summary: The English Language Unity Act of 2025 aims to declare English as the official language of the United States. It outlines requirements for federal government functions to be conducted in English and establishes a uniform English language rule for naturalization. The bill also includes provisions for the construction of laws in English, and directs the Secretary of Homeland Security to create a uniform English language testing standard. A National English Language Day is also proposed along with other provisions such as a federal obligation to preserve and enhance the role of English, while preserving certain exceptions.
